AF04F76BBAA64AE8A375074CF4BEC1E0.description: ALT 12 - Problem Solving: Reasons mathematically to solve problems using patterns and models in both a pure and applied context.

5FFB7CA0C74A4BE4BE8A3D6438266833.description: ALT 11 - Communication:  Communicates clearly and explains reasoning so others can follow how a problem is solved.

1DF580EF4C664171B721C291B4A82847.description: AST 10.5 - Concepts of Conditional Probability : Recognize, explain, and model (Venn Diagrams and Tree Diagrams) the concepts of conditional probability and independence.

77312401FF8D454AA6BB4172D21B8202.description: AST 10.4 - Use a Two-Way Table : Use a two-way table as a sample space to decide if events are independent and to approximate conditional probabilities.

36432610537541A4BFDDEAFCA0EF8767.description: AST 10.3 - Compute Complex Probabilities : Use general formulas to compute complex probabilities (“or”, “and”, “not”).

F06CB7D95FC747EBB64192BB61AF87BB.description: AST 10.2 - Demonstrate : Demonstrate that P(A and B) = P(A)*P(B)

BFDB0C7FC764482C98CA5667EEA438B3.description: AST 10.1 - Describe Events as Subsets : Describe events as subsets of a sample space (the set of outcomes) using characteristics (or categories) of the outcomes, or as unions, intersections, or complements of other events (“or”, “and”, “not”).

4E88BCEB910E49AF8D2C64EA85576D43.description: ALT 10 - Probability to Interpret Data:  I can use independence and conditional probability formally to interpret data and compute the probabilities of compound events.

605D898DF9FF4E139C911C505261E9FF.description: AST 9.4 - Compare-Compute Areas and Volumes : Given similar figures, compare and compute their respective areas and volumes.

F26A0CF3C02F4F7686665D2D1231D239.description: AST 9.3 - Prove Shapes are Similar : Prove whether or not two shapes are similar.

722FC3C4454B4F67A3BAC7109FD89E28.description: AST 9.2 - Apply Triangle Similarity Theorems : Apply the triangle similarity theorems (using AA, SSS and SAS) to solve problems in context.

D53B84EC6A7E4693B8DF23F730F715BC.description: AST 9.1 - Apply Similarity of Polygons : Apply the similarity of polygons to solve problems in context.

B43A8251BDE144CBB34FBBF534B565D9.description: ALT 9 - Laws of Similarity to Solve Problems:  I can apply the laws of similarity to solve problems and prove my solutions.

2F50D9097A0B46268B6884D7DC030D71.description: AST 8.4 - Identify Relationship Between 3-D-2-D : Identify the relationships between 2-D and 3-D figures using cross-sections and rotations.

90B52803CF8C4209A7CA747EFE0CD00C.description: AST 8.3 - Find Volume of 3-D Figures : Find the volume of 3-Dimensional figures, including applications.

0745E029A5D24622B20B9A44E6EF6454.description: AST 8.2 - Find Surface Area of 3-D Figures : Find the surface area of 3-Dimensional figures, including applications.

437B6482E5034EFF912C2ADE0D09BA81.description: AST 8.1 - Classify 3-D Figures from a Model : Identify and classify 3-Dimensional figures from a model, a net, and different perspectives.

23F98C5066EE4AFEBFC318656A1FAB9C.description: ALT 8 - 3-D Figures to Solve Problems:  I can apply the characteristics and properties of 3-Dimensional figures to solve problems (including applications) and justify my solutions.

BF9052FE70DF4ABCBBF7E9D12E86165C.description: AST 7.9 - Identify Non-Rigid Transformations : Identify and apply non-rigid transformations of geometric figures on and off the coordinate plane. (Dilation)

87381B5123DE4034A1EE2E2654E16169.description: AST 7.8 - Identify Rigid Transformations : Identify and represent rigid transformations of 2-dimensional figures on and off the coordinate plane. (Translations, Reflections over either axis and y=x, Rotations in multiples of 90o)

2E48D6CB92B74D5891CFD59A1404330A.description: AST 7.7 - Identify Lines of Symmetry : Identify lines of symmetry and distinguish between rotation and reflection symmetries given a rectangle, parallelogram, trapezoid, or regular polygon

EA4208E919A34B33BC2C2B74DFEF6CC1.description: AST 7.6 - Prove Theorems about Quadrilaterals : Prove theorems about quadrilaterals using coordinates (opposite sides are congruent, opposite angles are congruent, the diagonals of a parallelograms with congruent diagonals).

1A72EFE4061F40029B31F5772438823D.description: AST 7.5 - Compute Areas of Triangles-Rectangles : Use coordinates to compute the areas of triangles and rectangles, e.g., using the distance formula.

4ABAB32C2E3D4CCAB403DA4A5CE0E9B3.description: AST 7.4 - Use Coordinates to Compute Perimeters : Use coordinates to compute perimeters of polygons e.g., using the distance formula.

EA443B149AF847239067A87A0793DBED.description: AST 7.3 - Find Missing Coordinates : Given Midpoint or Distance, find the missing coordinates.

69A2E121446349B4AE780930C30F70EA.description: AST 7.2 - Solve Associated Geo. Problems : Determine that lines are parallel and perpendicular using the slope criteria and solve associated geometric problems.

DA523E99D8A14896BFF892C997F60CB9.description: AST 7.1 - Use Coordinates to prove Geom. Theorems : Use coordinates to prove simple geometric theorems algebraically and solve problems.

999BC4B18CC241C29E4E67AC5C154601.description: ALT 7 - Connect Linear Algebra:  I can connect linear algebra, coordinates, and transformations to geometric situations and use it to prove geometric theorems.

7BBC944A26F043ABAAC0B53A4BA6B725.description: AST 6.7 - Find Arc Length and Areas : Use formulas to find the arc length and area of sectors.

BE0FC79D7C2D48C381CF393612B7C71E.description: AST 6.6 - Find Area of Shaded Region : Find the area of the shaded region (shapes within shapes) and composite areas.

71A222D49A1D4ED3AE334D95EEA11599.description: AST 6.5 - Apply Congruence of Polygons : Apply the congruence of polygons to solve problems.

9EA4E457C6F04598A6E729C524FC8A9E.description: AST 6.4 - Find Unknown Sides and Angles : Find the unknown sides and angles of a variety of polygons, including applications.

B438054B993C49B1ABB1508E04916E09.description: AST 6.3 - Find Perimeter and Area of Polygons : Find the perimeter and area of a variety of polygons, including applications.

2A3DF992DD2740CDB81112B7136A8D89.description: AST 6.2 - Prove Theorems about Quadrilaterals : Prove theorems about quadrilaterals (opposite sides are congruent, opposite angles are congruent, the diagonals of a parallelograms with congruent diagonals-using triangle congruence).

EC0BEFC3C8B94EBFB9A06226D8D25F12.description: AST 6.1 - Classify and Compare Polygons : Classify and compare polygons (quadrilaterals, in particular) based on characteristics.

1FF6D8264C9D495895D001597CFFF5AC.description: ALT 6 - 2-D Figures to Solve Problems:  I can utilize the properties of two-dimensional figures to solve problems, including real-world applications.

8FF818175FDF41869076D5E0EFB4139E.description: AST 5.6 - Solve Right Triangles in Applied Problem : Use trigonometric ratios and the Pythagorean Theorem to solve right triangles in applied problems.

6AD3D811F22744F58D33F3566813AB15.description: AST 5.5 - Find Unknown Angles in Right Triangles : Use trigonometric ratios (sine, cosine, and tangent) to find the unknown angles in right triangles.

F5ACAE35952F4BA09579CDB853A632C2.description: AST 5.4 - Use Trigonometric Ratios : Use trigonometric ratios (sine, cosine, and tangent) to find the unknown lengths in right triangles.

E14D7BF612A24DD08A0B93C1E55B7238.description: AST 5.3 - Special Right Triangles : Demonstrate and use properties of “special” right triangles (45-45-90, 30-60-90)

20D46DFBE12E4A20ACF7336A003A5F23.description: AST 5.2 - Use the Pythagorean Theorem : Use the Pythagorean Theorem to find unknown lengths of right triangles and whether the triangle is right, obtuse or acute and justify my thinking.

6EE499E269A24FC1892D73019CF5657A.description: AST 5.1 - Determine if Triangle can be Created : Determine, if given three side lengths, a triangle can be created and justify my thinking.

EF83A4A6976F47F09B98132D88F1E9FC.description: ALT 5 - Right Triangles:  I can solve for unknown lengths and angles in right triangles and justify my solutions.

87C71FEAB9B84AB9A73AE957CF16ECF6.description: AST 4.5 - Understand Origins of Points : Understand origins of points of concurrency (Centroid, Incenter, Circumcenter and Orthocenter) of a triangle.

C76A3AED61E2435E826CEC0F0B85019D.description: AST 4.4 - Justify Steps Taken Missing Measures : I can use theorems to justify steps taken in finding missing measures.

B2C83891613D4B3FB394DD59155EA4C2.description: AST 4.3 - Congruent Triangles Theorem : I can use Corresponding Parts of Congruent Triangles Theorem to determine and prove other statements.

9D94171114C947F084A867D42F65D9F8.description: AST 4.2 - Prove Triangles Congruent : I can use a diagram that marks the congruent segments and angles and formally prove if two triangles are congruent.

FB5E5AEE2A11440EA74229F34559C60A.description: AST 4.1 - Use Diagram Congruent Segments : I can use a diagram that marks the congruent segments and angles and determine if two triangles are congruent.

25957DC934F34110BF50B447BFEA03F9.description: ALT 4 - Congruence Theorems and Triangles:  I can prove and apply congruence theorems dealing with triangles to solve problems and justify my solutions.

45705E95D7E5467C8781E9E8214039FE.description: AST 3.5 - Use Theorems to Justify Steps : Use theorems to justify steps taken in finding missing measures.

EDD1187997084455888CB350B6D743FD.description: AST 3.4 - Use Angle Measures to Prove Lines : Use angle measures to prove lines parallel and perpendicular.

61B6EA38F1484307A3F69F947965B086.description: AST 3.3 - Paralel and Perpendicular Lines : Apply and prove theorems and use properties dealing with parallel and perpendicular lines.

B03DEE4B8E8F4D8AB6B1337DB0CF111A.description: AST 3.2 - Complementary and Supplementary Angles : Apply and prove theorems and use properties dealing with complementary and supplementary angles.

7D52E10CFA0B40B78EFDA034544C5B9F.description: AST 3.1 - Apply and Prove Theorems : Apply and prove theorems and use properties dealing with vertical angles and a linear pair of angles.

24C62BA396884ABB97408F07A2C84BD5.description: ALT 3 - Congruence Theorems:  I can prove and apply congruence theorems dealing with angles and lines to solve problems and justify my solutions.

A851305566BC4951B1229B208591B669.description: AST 2.5 - Use Definitions and Postulates : Use definitions and postulates to build and defend a logical argument.

C6292B6F3C164406AE263D93D445BB10.description: AST 2.4 - Congruent Circles : This includes the use of congruent circles, concentric circles, radius, chord, diameter, tangent, point of tangency, central angle, and inscribed angle.

106AE72EB57940BCB0640C421B915B31.description: AST 2.3 - Apply Symbols : Correctly apply the following symbols and correct notation including but not limited to: congruency marks on a diagram, parallel and perpendicular indicators, designating lines, segments, and rays, equal, congruent, not congruent, etc. to interpret and solve problems.

A1474A07C5F84B13996C5E50F52A010C.description: AST 2.2 - Correctly Identify Vocabulary : Correctly identify in words and symbols the following vocabulary including but not limited to: undefined terms (point, line, plane), collinear, coplanar, line segment, ray, midpoint, endpoint, bisect, congruent segment, acute, obtuse, right, straight, vertex, degree, angle bisector, congruent angles, vertical angles, linear pairs, complementary angles, supplementary angles, counterexample, and consecutive interior angles.

0F2483464E3C49E59F9EC2B49ABFECF3.description: AST 2.1 - Consistently Translate : Consistently translate between vocabulary, symbols and or a diagram to communicate.

CA16C8371A0D4DEFA61D013253BBCA82.description: ALT 2 - Foundations of Geometry:  I can demonstrate my understanding of the foundations of geometry.

50B5B1F396C64A74800EF0D0450D7300.description: AST 1.6 - Determine Type of Sample : Determine the type of sampling used and identify any potential bias.

2E13B07539874759B5D99102C9687AE5.description: AST 1.5 - Analyze and Compare Data Sets : Analyze and compare data sets using measures of center, spread and position.

C81B031B7618455A86606083ACCBC2F2.description: AST 1.4 - Compute Measures of Position : Compute measures of position including minimum, maximum, first quartile, third quartile, and percentiles.

F08F32B93B1043428B13CF315A5AE15F.description: AST 1.3 - Measures of Spread : Compute or find with a calculator measures of spread including standard deviation, range, and interquartile range.

886ADDBC03C744209A19AC7ADA17D96C.description: AST 1.2 - Compute Measures of Center : Compute measures of center including mean and median.

C6A4728CB02C441684D7A491E19A06A2.description: AST 1.1 - Graphically Rep. Single Variable Data : Graphically represent single variable data using dot plots, histograms, and box plot.

D80FE044BA2A4CE5B69975A4D710A721.description: ALT 1 - Single Variable Data:  I can display and describe single variable data and identify sampling bias.
